channel.title: - Articles
channel.description: A blog about IT in Île-de-France region

item.title: Paris-Saclay University
item.description: Unlike all the schools I mentioned here, Paris-Saclay University is not just a simple university, but a group of universities in Île-de-France Region specializing in many scientific fields. Paris-Saclay also brings together France’s largest technology hub and offers to French and international students world-renowned degrees.

item.title: AgoraNov
item.description: Founded more than 16 years ago, AgoraNov is one of the largest incubators in Île-de-France and France with more than 300 incubated startups, including successful companies such as the advertising giant Criteo, the doctor appointment management app Doctolib or the world robotics giant Aldebaran (now SoftBank Robotics). The incubator is also sponsored by many universities and public companies around the country.

item.title: EPITA
item.description: Specialized in Computer Science and Engineering since 1984, EPITA is a private French engineering school located a few minutes from Paris, which offers several degree programs in English for international students, from Bachelor to Master.

item.title: La Ruche
item.description: La Ruche (hive in English) is a network of incubators dedicated to social innovation. Its action includes co-working, incubation, events, but also the establishment of large-scale partnerships allowing each actor or startup to give birth to his project or idea in the best conditions, be it at Paris, in the region or in the whole of France with different “hives”.

item.title: Ecole 42
item.description: École 42 is a French institution specialized in free and open courses without any prerequisites. During 2 to 5 years, the school trains hundreds of developers by proposing the “self-study” learning method through dozens of projects and programming rushs (called “pools”).

item.title: NUMA
item.description: Not just an open space for entrepreneurs, NUMA is an international hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups. Training and follow-up are at the heart of NUMA’s philosophy.

item.title: Sorbonne University
item.description: Created from the merger of highly reputable universities UPMC and Paris Sorbonne, Sorbonne University is one of the biggest Parisian universities, with more than 55,000 students on its various campuses. The university offers several courses in computer science, in French or in English, for long or short periods.

item.title: IncubAlliance
item.description: Incubator of the Paris-Saclay cluster since 2005, IncubAlliance’s main mission is to create bridges between startups, companies, labor and research experts within the Paris-Saclay campus, through support, training and hosting services for startups and education stakeholders.

item.title: Epitech
item.description: Epitech (also called European Institute of Technology) is a private Computer Science School with multiple campuses around the world and in Europe. The school offers computer courses to international and exchange students.

item.title: Pépinière 27
item.description: With more than 100 startups incubated in a general and multi-disciplinary ecosystem, Pépinière 27 is a Parisian incubator offering both a flexible hosting and support services, but also a rich and inspiring infrastructure, like a natural greenhouse where knowledge flourishes.

item.title: Efrei
item.description: Located only 15 minutes from Paris, Efrei is a general engineering school of digital technologies created almost 90 years ago. Efrei delivers a French engineering degree since 1957 and offers French and English courses to foreign students.

item.title: Startup42
item.description: Founded in 2013 by EPITA, Startup42 is a “fast & serious” project accelerator designed to offer hacker teams with a good idea the skills and opportunities they need to become startup founders, create an impactful product and actually sell it.

item.title: Isep
item.description: Just minutes from the Montparnasse Tower and train station, Isep is a private engineering school specializing in digital technologies (IT, electronics, multimedia, networks) and attached to the Catholic University of Paris. Isep offers different courses for international students over different periods (semester, year).
